step.text: Position the lamp forward - pull the handle, like this...
If the lamp is bright, push the button until the lamp is dim.
Position the Specimen on the bench in Zone 1.
Position the Short Focal Length Lens 3 inches from the Specimen. Use the measuring rule to be accurate.
Position the Eyepiece 2 inches from the Short Focal Length Lens so that the small opening is to the right.
Make sure the lamp is on the dim setting. Take a peek. To focus, slide the Short Focal Length Lens back and forth.

explanation.text: A microscope magnifies small objects. A short focal length objective lens forms an image, and the eyepiece magnifies it. Objects viewed with a microscope are placed very close to the objective lens. Because the objective has a very short focal length, an enlarged image is formed. A short focal length eyepiece is used to magnify the image even further. A shorter focal length objective and a shorter focal length eyepiece will result in greater magnification.
